
Alice encrypted her secret with RSA, but unknowingly chose n as a product of two Blum integers. Can you recover the message from 329490339934015321056647484848865595223915145441643698710766974973089837262950347653516132959626787380218428845414623418206910331734195068350258002045561?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=8361868462364742149680417032771617297028333913342981218322728973955765602717777045991367572982248001437946432649560919335569639180997448063567193488063877, e=4155978287361117625905695145317490802009804277998590261165640132279445377408629889603248838248540903623253327628987140034143133233426671140293514653852137
The lower 104 bits of p are: 81388124961095755110531191671335986095


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{o0zikcpq}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 329490339934015321056647484848865595223915145441643698710766974973089837262950347653516132959626787380218428845414623418206910331734195068350258002045561
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8361868462364742149680417032771617297028333913342981218322728973955765602717777045991367572982248001437946432649560919335569639180997448063567193488063877, e=4155978287361117625905695145317490802009804277998590261165640132279445377408629889603248838248540903623253327628987140034143133233426671140293514653852137
The lower 104 bits of p are: 81388124961095755110531191671335986095

extra_info: p=91689396924651017378749343534646913833302645311407138722931395439124490527663, q=91197769238643823550718936515518515511110521000522972457014668284186782669579, Ï†(n)=8361868462364742149680417032771617297028333913342981218322728973955765602717594158825204278141318533157896267220216506169257709069817501999843882214866636
